node.statement: NON-EQUALITY CASES (PROVED). Let N_E be ultrametric on V=k², N_F any norm on W=k². Write v₁=c₁e₁-αv₃, v₂=c₂e₂-βv₃ where c₁,c₂ arise from the tensor equation. Case analysis: (i) If |c₁|>|α|·N_E(v₃), then by isosceles N_E(v₁)=|c₁|, so T₁=|c₁|·N_F(w₁)≥collapsed term₁. (ii) If |c₁|<|α|·N_E(v₃), then N_E(v₁)=|α|·N_E(v₃)>|c₁|, so T₁>|c₁|·N_F(w₁)≥collapsed term₁. In both strict-inequality cases (for both j=1,2 independently), T₁+T₂≥collapsed cost=N_E(v₁+αv₃)·N_F(w₁)+N_E(v₂+βv₃)·N_F(w₂)≥1 (by the proved independent-case bound, since e₁⊗e₁=(v₁+αv₃)⊗w₁+(v₂+βv₃)⊗w₂ is a 2-term independent representation). With T₃≥0, we get C≥1. This works for ALL pairs (N_E,N_F) with N_E ultrametric — the argument uses N_E and N_F independently and never assumes N_E=N_F.
